findings.title: Cross-Site Scripting via innerHTML
findings.message: Potential XSS vulnerability: User input assigned to innerHTML.
findings.remediation: Use textContent instead of innerHTML, or sanitize HTML content.

findings.title: Code Injection via eval()
findings.message: Using eval() allows arbitrary code execution.
findings.remediation: Avoid eval() entirely. Use JSON.parse() for data.

findings.title: Code Injection via setTimeout with String
findings.message: Using setTimeout with string allows code injection.
findings.remediation: Pass a function reference instead of a string.

findings.title: Cross-Site Scripting via document.write
findings.message: Using document.write can lead to XSS.

findings.title: Cross-Site Scripting via innerHTML
findings.message: Potential XSS vulnerability: User input assigned to innerHTML.
findings.remediation: Use textContent instead of innerHTML, or sanitize HTML content.

findings.title: Code Injection via eval()
findings.message: Using eval() allows arbitrary code execution.
findings.remediation: Avoid eval() entirely. Use JSON.parse() for data.

findings.title: Code Injection via setTimeout with String
findings.message: Using setTimeout with string allows code injection.
findings.remediation: Pass a function reference instead of a string.

findings.title: Cross-Site Scripting via document.write
findings.message: Using document.write can lead to XSS.

findings.title: SQL Injection via String Concatenation
findings.message: Potential SQL injection vulnerability detected. User input is directly concatenated into SQL query.
findings.remediation: Use prepared statements with parameter binding instead of string concatenation.

findings.title: Local File Inclusion (LFI) Vulnerability
findings.remediation: Validate and sanitize file paths. Use a whitelist of allowed files.

findings.title: Command Injection Vulnerability
findings.remediation: Never pass user input directly to system commands.

findings.title: SQL Injection via String Concatenation
findings.message: Potential SQL injection vulnerability detected. User input is directly concatenated into SQL query.
findings.remediation: Use prepared statements with parameter binding instead of string concatenation.

findings.title: Local File Inclusion (LFI) Vulnerability
findings.remediation: Validate and sanitize file paths. Use a whitelist of allowed files.

findings.title: Command Injection Vulnerability
findings.remediation: Never pass user input directly to system commands.

findings.title: Potential Taint Flow
findings.message: Untrusted data from _GET may reach dangerous sink exec
findings.remediation: Validate and sanitize input before using in sensitive operations

findings.title: Potential Taint Flow
findings.message: Untrusted data from _GET may reach dangerous sink system
findings.remediation: Validate and sanitize input before using in sensitive operations
